question:
Which of the following statements are correct?
1. Bhitarkanika mangroves are the second largest in the Indian sub continent.
2. Mangrove swamps also occur in the intertidal mudflats on both side of the creeks in the Godavari- Krishna deltaic regions of Andhra Pradesh.
3. Mangroves of Pichavaram and Vedaranyam are degraded mainly due to construction of aquaculture ponds and salt pans.
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Bhitarkanika mangroves are the second largest in the Indian sub continent. Mangrove swamps also occur in the intertidal mudflats on both side of the creeks in the Godavari- Krishna deltaic regions of Andhra Pradesh. Mangroves of Pichavaram and Vedaranyam are degraded mainly due to construction of aquaculture ponds and salt pans.
